title: Can We Have The Separate Search Bar Back?
content:
Hi Folks:

For desktop Firefox.

Until a couple of weeks ago I could have a search bar next to the address bar.

This allowed me to enter a search request and then see the search result's page with the page's address in the address bar.

If I wanted to repeat the search, or modify the search, the search request would still be in the search bar.

Now I only have the address bar. If the page found by the search isn't what I want I need to re-type the search into the address bar where it will be overwritten by the address of the result of the search.

That can be inconvenient.

I no longer see the option for a separate search bar in Firefox's search settings.

Am I the only person who misses this feature?

Is the separate search bar available if I know how to ask for it?

Thanks Larry

title: Can't see Saved Passwords
content:
Normally, when I open my FF browser, a box opens asking for my Primary Password which I enter and then whenever I go to a website for which I have a username and password saved, they are filled in automatically. Occasionally the box for login doesn't open when I first open the browser (I don't know why) and when that happens, I go to Settings|Privacy & Security| click on "Saved passwords", which opens a page listing all the websites for which I have saved usernames & passwords. I finding the entry for the site I wish to log into, click "copy password" and a login box opens asking for my Primary Password which I enter and all is well. I copy the password for the site I want to use and after that, whichever site I visit, the username & password are automatically filled in.

However, this morning, that didn't happen. When I clicked on "Saved passwords", a new tab opened with a header in the middle of the page labelled "Save your passwords to a new spot". The text below the header had several hyperlinks, none of which worked. At the top of the page was a ribbon with the phrase "Please enter your Primary Password to view saved logins & passwords". Beside that phrase was a login button. When I click on the login button it just jumps up & down but no login box opens. I can't login and I can't see my passwords.

I have posted an image of the page in question below.

My FF updated this morning to 137.0.1 (64 bit). Perhaps that is the problem, I don't know. Can anyone offer a solution? Thanks for any ideas you can suggest to solve this problem ~ Boyd

title: Facebook won't load via Firefox
content:
Hello

I'm using a Mac with 15.0.1. I downloaded Firefox a couple of days ago. All seems to be working fine. I've not made any settings changes and all websites seem to be operating as expected. However, I cannot get Facebook to load at all. I know that when I tried using Mozilla Firefox in the past I had the same problem and eventually just gave up. When I enter www.facebook.com with a URL and press enter, I get the following: "

Unable to connect

Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at facebook.com. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the web.    If you are trying to load a local network page, please check that Firefox has been granted Local Network permissions in the macOS Privacy & Security settings.

"

It's important to note that I have not made any changes to the default settings. I have not in any way configured or changed any settings at all. So I would expect this to work out of the box. Firefox is: 137.0.1 (aarch64).

Not sure why this is happening and why I need to go through so many directions to trying work out why a simple website won't work. Any help would be really appreciated.

title: Comprehensive Guide to 9th Class Math Solutions
content:
Introduction: Mathematics is a subject that requires deep understanding and practice, and 9th grade is one of the most crucial stages in a student's academic journey. In this class, students are introduced to more advanced concepts, which form the foundation for higher-level studies in mathematics. This article will provide a detailed guide to the 9th-grade math syllabus, covering essential topics, formulas, and step-by-step solutions to common problems. Whether you're looking for a better understanding of algebra, geometry, or trigonometry, this guide will help you master the key concepts.

At NotesOfMath, our goal is to simplify complex mathematical problems and provide students with high-quality resources, including solved examples, formulas, and notes. The website serves as a valuable aid for students preparing for their 9th-grade exams and beyond.

title: 2025/04/09 Firefox bookmarks and tags missing. Restore not working.
content:
An hour ago I had all of my Firefox bookmarks. Ten years of meticulously filed and regularly culled references that I use multiple times daily. I rarely log out of Firefox sync, so that I can keep them up to date.

I now have no bookmarks and no tags.

For some context, two things just happened simultaneously. So, I'm not entirely sure which is the culprit.

1) Firefox just updated and I rebooted my computer.

2) Norton 360 updated sometime in the past two days. I attempted to familiarise myself with the new interface. Foolishly, given the track record of Norton-360-for-breaking-your-games, I ran the disc cleanup, which recommended I remove approximately 400 Mb of data. Norton stated this data was temporary files. If they were indeed my bookmark history, nowhere did Norton indicate they were bookmarks. Also, never have I encountered a disc cleanup that wholesale wipes bookmarks. I do hope Norton is not the culprit and this is just a glitch, because if this were due to Norton having no safety net for deleting an entire library of bookmarks - and they can't help me restore them - then that will be the final nail in the coffin for me doing business with Norton.

The suggestion to go to Import and Backup in Firefox, then click Restore, offers only the option of Choose file... - and then launches nothing.

Currently, I'm seeking any means of restoring my bookmarks. Any help would be appreciated.

I had presumed that I was taking reasonable measures through my Firefox Sync settings to protect my bookmarks and ensure they could be restored in the event of accidents. If these bookmarks are permanently lost, the amount of work I've just lost is quite the blow.

Edit No. 01: After writing this, my Bookmarks Toolbar is also now empty. Perhaps it had wiped earlier, but was merely waiting for a refresh to take effect.

Edit No. 02: Also, it seems I am unable to create any new bookmarks. I shall read the help suggestions relating to that now, to see if it's a relevant issue.

title: Very slow to load websites. Sometimes not at all.
content:
Hello! I am working on a brand new computer (i7 14700F, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 Super, 32GB DDR5) with a brand new install of Firefox and sometimes it just won't load certain pages without me stopping it, refreshing, and then (most of the time) it all pops in. Browsing the web works perfectly in Edge, but in Firefox it has been a struggle. Some sites, like Discord, load VERY slowly and most of the time I need to force a refresh via shift and hitting refresh. Discord will take so long to load any image that I see it as a colorful blur before the photo fully loads in for view.

I'm running the most recent version of Windows 11, Firefox v137.0.1 (also had this issue with v137).

I have tried things in Troubleshoot Mode and didn't make a difference. I uninstalled Firefox, removed the %APPDATA%\Mozilla\ folder, and reinstalled but no change. What I haven't tried is Refresh Firefox, but that's because since Troubleshoot Mode didn't make a difference it's a bit hard to imagine Refresh Firefox will -- but if people think it's worth trying I certainly will give it a go!

I've been a FF user for as long as I can remember and I really don't want to give it up so hopefully someone can help me figure out what's going on here because I am currently at a loss and it's a big bummer.

Thanks in advance for the help!
